content: Is it just my machine, or are there a lot of tests that time out after 60 seconds in src/test/ui these days?
I usually count max 1, but re-running fixes it usually.
20+ for me, I guess it's my machine.
Where do you notice that the tests are timing out? I haven't observed that before.
I do see a number of ignored tests
When running x.py test src/test/ui, it will alert you if tests time out.
I think "time out" is maybe not the right phrasing -- we don't error when that happens, right? It's just a warning?
That's a warning from libtest directly I think
Yes, it's just a warning. I don't remember what the exact phrasing is.

varkor said:

When running x.py test src/test/ui, it will alert you if tests time out.

Sure, I think this has 10780 as all possible tests running ./x.py test.

test result: ok. 3 passed; 0 failed; 10780 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out

    finished in 0.336
Build completed successfully in 0:00:00
